reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well, this is actually a way better version than Pool Nation FX, especially for snooker fans like me. I like the authentic feel of the snookertables, the cues, the different area's you can play in, etc.
It's Early Access which means I experienced some fatal errors and I think there's still something wrong with the achievements but I am confident it will be fixed ASAP.

The game is really worth the price. You don't have any reason to hesitate.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Early access - but very promising and nice to see the devs quite engaged and eager to listen to the community as they iron out and refine the game.

Some occasional whachy physics (which the devs voiced refining) and some sound and bug fixing required - but a very enjoyable and thoroughly playable game in this early stage.

F2P would be a mistake in my opinion and the price with or without loyalty discount is very well worth it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Really not sure why people have given this a negative..... The early access version already feels like a polished game!

Graphics- Look really nice (Dont really expect much more from a snooker game)
Mechanics and physics- Play really good
AI- Have not experienced anything strange yet

To improve this game I would really like to see
- a character creation mode for the championship
- A training mode which leads you though each shot and teaches you how to use the cue angle, spin to get position
- (Not to fussed about this) The real player names and likenesses.

For just £3 its well worth your money! The fact its early access makes me excited to see the features they are going to add.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nA decent game with a few flaws. It would be nice if after taking a shot the camera would follow the object ball to show if it's gone in the pocket or not and if not by how much it has missed by. Also using either the mouse or the x box controller i find aiming can be tricky.  You try and fine tune your aim only to find that some times the cue just shoots of in a totally different direction. For an early access game though it shows great potential and unlike some other early access games is priced sensibly. If you are a snooker fan or just want to play something different I would recommend it

reviewText:
Early Access Review

needs a bit of work. Its early access so still in terms of game play rough..

cushions tend to have an odd bounce to them most of the time...
some of the angles when hitting the balls seem out.. get rediculous bounces out the pockets even at medium pace
dont know if the sounds of the balls 'clicking' together disappear but seems an awful lot of push shots with no sound

still havent figured out how to add bottom/spin to the ball.. I hope its not moving the mouse back and forwards quickly..

When tight to the cushion the view is obscured by the 'transparent' cue which gets annoying..

AI is wierd.. standard difficulty and they are playing cannons at some very strange angles into the middle pockets!
It would be good if the AI aim was actually where the ball was going (they can be aiming straight yet the ball comes off at an angle).

Graphics are excellent. would prefer to have the keyboard configured to move the camera up and down the table rather than having to push the mouse..

most annonying things in the game... mostly sounds are a let down.

the floppy people in the snooker hall.. what on earth are they doing?
the referee constantly shouting for mobile phones to be turned off or to be quiet and let the players concentrate.. even though no mobile has gone off and there is no noise coming from the crowd...
the way they cut off the clapping and oohs and aaahs.. it just stops dead
the referee echo no matter whether you are in a hall /club or Championship table.. its like playing in an empty cave..

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

A Snooker Simulatorhttps://youtu.be/ASjqcDzA824
+ The gameplay is excellent, you can hit the ball anywhere you like, make angle shots, jump shots, adjust your power shots, there's helpful indicators that show you where each ball may end up, and even an overview camera.
+ Visually pleasing, made in the Unreal Engine so of course the lighting and detail looks fantastic
+ A really amazing game for people who enjoy Snooker, Pool, or are beginners and trying to learn the basics like me
+ A zoom-in / slow-motion camera that adds excitement to close shots (also looks very nice zoomed in)
+ Great background music, and realistic sounds

This game is in Early Access so don't take these too seriously
- There's an audio bug that makes the main menu music much louder after you leave a game
- I wish there was a rulebook or a better tutorial that taught you how to play. I had to look up a youtube video just to learn how to play the game as the tutorial only teaches you how to hit the ball and not how to play.

If you don't know how to play Snooker here is a very basic guide from what I've learned:
- To begin you break the group of red balls
- On your turn you want to hit a red ball into the pocket
- If you miss your turn ends, if you make it you then want to hit a colored ball
- If you get a colored ball into the pocket you then must hit a red ball (and repeat until you miss)
- Colored balls are worth more points, and are reset on the table each time someone hits one into the pocket.
- The goal is to get all the red balls into the pockets, and then afterwards hit all the colored balls in order into the pocket from least to greatest value.
- Whoever has the highest point value at the end wins

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Best Snooker game I've ever played. The game is really polished, especially for Early Access. Graphics are really nice and crisp. Lots of different game modes to choose from (was surprised to find there is also two player versus and multiplayer!

However the Sound effects are lacking in quality, especially when the balls kiss each other, decent sound effects are lacking. And what's up with that overly loud referee with no option in audio settings to turn his voice down? lol

AI could use some tweaks and the handling of the cue can prove to be tricky sometimes using a Mouse, in particular the power-up of your shots.

But overall a great game worth its great price.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

You can tell this game is still in early access. A fair few things need polishing, like the referee's voice etc. But the referee calling out to crowd to be quiet is a nice touch, even when the crowd makes no real audible noise at all...The main area that you immediately notice needs attention is the audio. But, as stated, the game is in EA so that's perfectly understandable.

As for the mechanics, the game takes probably about half an hour to get the hang of. If you already know the rules of snooker very well and watch the sport regularly it will be even quicker probably. The design of the game is good and the graphics quality are great. The controls are actually really well thought out, and the user interface is handy - particularly the aim assist, which goes red if you're aiming at a ball which isn't on, for example. Definitely a game to unwind to with a beer after work, or something light hearted to play if you're a bit stressed out.

It's surprisingly addictive, and rewarding. When you get that tricky shot on the cushion just right, and the side on the cue ball perfect, the ball pots, the white comes away from the cushion perfect for the black - it's just satisfying for any snooker fan. If you don't know snooker very well, but enjoy playing other table sports, you may also find this game really interesting. Definitely well worth the few pounds paid for.

For an Early Access game this is looking very promising indeed , couple that with the very modest price tag and you have what looks to be a really nice game for snooker fans , GFX are really nice, physics are pretty much spot on , I'm sure Cherry Pop will continue to improve this game with more updates over the next few months, I can see this game appealling to non-snooker fans aswell as followers and players of this great sport. Top Marks to the Devs, this is a very easy game to recommend.

My hopes for this game would be the addition of a career mode which follows the Pro snooker tour , and who knows maybe even official licensing from the WPBSA & worldsnooker.

Pleasant on the eye , easy on the wallet.

A quality EA game 10/10.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Dont buy this peice of rubbish, the AI is so terrible that you will just lose all the time. The cue ball control is non existant for the player but is spot on for the AI. If you are lucky (and i mean lucky) and you manage to get ahead in a tournament, the AI will make it almost impossible to get any kind of positional shots and you just have to sit back and watch as the AI takes frame after frame.
Havent tried multiplayer yet but, going on the AI play so far, even in easy mode its almost impossible to achieve much.
Its still a work in progress as i am aware but still, they could have tried to put out a better game.
Someone said it was a steal for the price, well, they must have had a word with the effin AI ingame because that steals all the effin shots and frames.
Just a quick update, do not use force play-on" on the AI after it has commited a foul as it will place the cue ball in a convienient place therefore negating the unplayable situation it had placed itself in. Also beware of the AI calling Foul" "push shot" on you when the cue ball is near the pack of reds
date: this is a glitch and will most certainly cost you a lot of points.\nAnd finaly
recommended: do not be disapointed when playing in the solo player tournaments
hoursPlayed: the AI is ramped up to pro level when you get into the quater finals
